column4: is there a proper way to get anti-aliased fonts with google earth? i tried using the system qt but that breaks images in the popups (just a gray box is shown).
(so for example is there a specific qt version that might work?! or another trick?!)
i use the Google Earth from Medibuntu, and the fonts are anti-aliased... the AA is pretty bad, but it's there
hmm ok i'll try the mediabuntu version. used the "package builder"-version from multiverse(?)
but you use ge 4.3 not 4.2, right?
did you change any settings? because the medibuntu version just shows plain fonts here not anti-aliased ones :(
well, i don't think i changed anything from inside google earth... but i'm on KDE, for a start
*shrug* i can post a screenshot i suppose
http://img244.imageshack.us/my.php?image=93189390oe8.png looks like bad antialiasing, but antialiasing, to me
i have a CRT so it's admittedly hard to tell for sure
